instructions:
Peel & Cut the Potatoes

Peel the potatoes (or keep the skin if you like rustic fries).

Slice into even sticks about ¼ inch thick. Uniform size = even cooking.

Soak the Potatoes

Place the cut fries in a bowl of cold water.

Soak for at least 30 minutes (removes excess starch → crispier fries).

Drain and pat completely dry with a clean kitchen towel.

First Fry (Blanching)

Heat oil in a deep pan to about 150°C (300°F).

Fry the potatoes in small batches for 4–5 minutes.

They should be soft but not browned.

Remove and drain on paper towels.

Second Fry (Crisping)

Increase oil heat to 190°C (375°F).

Fry the blanched potatoes again for 2–3 minutes until golden and crispy.

Drain excess oil on paper towels.

Season & Serve

Sprinkle salt (and any extra seasoning) immediately while hot.

Serve with ketchup, mayo, or any dip you like.

Boil the pasta
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook according to package instructions (usually 8–10 minutes), until al dente. Drain and set aside.

Make the garlic butter sauce
In a large pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1–2 minutes, until fragrant (don’t let it burn!). Add a splash of olive oil if desired.

Toss the pasta
Add the drained spaghetti to the pan. Toss well to coat the pasta in the garlic butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Serve
Plate the pasta and top with chopped parsley and grated Parmesan if using.
